meanings.definition: The falling down or slipping out of place of an organ or part, such as the uterus or rectum.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed the patient with a prolapsus of the uterus.
meanings.sent2: The prolapsus of the rectum required surgical intervention.
meanings.sent3: The prolapsus of the bladder made the patient giggle during the examination.
meanings.sent4: Her prolapsus of the stomach felt like a heavy burden she carried every day.
meanings.sent5: The prolapsus of the heart symbolized her emotional struggles.

meanings.definition: A condition in which an organ or part is displaced or protrudes from its normal position.
meanings.sent1: The prolapsus of the intestines caused severe discomfort for the patient.
meanings.sent2: She underwent surgery to correct the prolapsus of her kidney.
meanings.sent3: The prolapsus of the liver seemed to have a mind of its own.
meanings.sent4: His prolapsus of the lung felt like a deflated balloon inside his chest.
meanings.sent5: The prolapsus of the brain was a metaphor for his scattered thoughts.
